clues.text: Jeff Daniels wrote "Escanaba in da Moonlight", a "super Yooper comedy" set on this state's Upper Peninsula
In 2004 he won an Oscar for "Mystic River" & appeared off-Broadway in his own play "Embedded"
This Englishwoman called her "Shakespeare for My Father" a play about her father (Sir Michael) & her search for him
Her husband Jerry Stiller made a video appearance in her 1999 comedy "Down the Garden Paths"
In 2004 this author of "True West" returned to the stage, acting in "A Number", a play about human cloning
The company founded by Henry Sherwin & this man wanted to use the halftime to demonstrate how paint dried
Rosewood School wanted to play this game where if you're tagged as a female swimming bird, you're it

This ex-FCC chairman, Colin's son, wanted to hold a town hall meeting to discuss obscenity on TV
Writer Ted Kooser, given this title by the Library of Congress, was going to read his work "Delights and Shadows"
This 1941 film is "everyone's default choice for the world's greatest movie"
"72 years after he emerged from his jungle lair, this remains one of the movies' immortal tales of unrequited love"
"Film noir was a tired genre before writer Robert Towne and director Roman Polanski made this" 1974 film
"This (1994) multipart crime epic... still has the impact of an adrenalin shot to the heart"

Jesus uttered 9 of these, from the Latin for "blessedness", in the sermon on the mount
This West Virginian has cast more votes in the Senate than any other senator in history

While we eternally accept Holland, this is the more accurate name for the country

He went by a shorter name, but William Claude Dukenfield is an acceptable answer when referring to this actor
You don't have to be high society to know that Society of Friends is an acceptable alternative name for this group
When asking for the name of this mid-20th century British author, we will of course accept his real name, Eric Blair

Yale & the University of Georgia both use this nickname for their sports teams

The name of this Georgia swamp is a Native American word for "trembling earth"

This cellphone maker has jumped back to the No. 2 spot worldwide by a Razr's edge
This company beat out Qwest to buy MCI & become a telecom colossus

Ordained a priest in 1904, his papacy would begin a scant 54 years later
In 858 vestments were hung with great care, in hopes that the first pope of this name soon would be there
This pope (the IV), elected in 1154, is the only English pope to date

"Old Possum's Book of Practical" these

"Red" this

"The Painted" this

"All the Pretty" these

"The Arm of" this sea creature
